trial_identification.studytitle: Randomised Controlled Trial of Exposure and Cognitive Restructuring for Reduction in Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Symptoms
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Randomised Controlled Trial of Exposure and Cognitive Restructuring for Reduction in Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Symptoms After Exposure to Any Traumatic Event

interventions.interventions: There are 4 arms to this trial. Arm 1: Imaginal Exposure only. Arm 2: In Vivo Exposure only. Arm 3: Imaginal Exposure and In Vivo Exposure combined. Arm 4: Imaginal Expsoure, In Vivo Exposure and Cognitive Restructuring combined. Therapy is administered in once-weekly 90-minute sessions of one-on-one therapy with a clinical psychologist over 8 weeks. Imaginal exposure includes imaginal reliving of trauma memories. In vivo exposure includes gradual exposure to feared situations. Cognitive restructuring includes training reappraisal of the trauma experience. The duration of the study for any participant will conclude after the 6-month follow-up assessment, resulting in participation duration of 8 months.
interventions.comparator: The Imaginal Exposure condition involves 8 once-weekly 90-minute sessions of individual therapy over 8 weeks. The therapy includes imaginal reliving of trauma memories. The In Vivo Exposure condition involves 8 once-weekly 90-minute sessions of individual therapy over 8 weeks. The therapy includes gradual exposure to feared situations. The Imaginal Exposure/In Vivo Exposure Condition involves 8 once-weekly 90-minute sessions of individual therapy over 8 weeks. The therapy includes imaginal reliving of trauma memories and gradual exposure to feared situations. The duration of the study for any participant will conclude after the 6-month follow-up assessment, resulting in participation duration of 8 months.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Posttraumatic stress disorder as measured by the Clinician Administered Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Scale

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Depression as measured by the Beck Depression Inventory

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: (1) Exposure to trauma, (2) Meet criteria for PTSD

trial_design.concealment: Participants will be treatment seeking patients attending the Traumatic Stress Clinic at Westmead Hospital. Participants will be randomly assigned according to a random numbers system administered by an individual who is independent of the study and who works at a site that is distant from the treatment center.
trial_design.sequence: Randomization will be conducted by a process of minimization stratified on gender, trauma type, and Posttraumatic Stress Disorder severity.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study will randomly allocate patients with PTSD to either (a) imaginal exposure, (b) in vivo exposure, (c) combined imaginal and in vivo exposure, or (d) combined imaginal, in vivo exposure, and cognitive restructuring.
